subsection.name: Spot
subsection.p: Example that shows the calculation of a Spot date with 2 different spotLags. SpotLag is typically 2 days but this may vary by market and/or currencies.

subsection.name: 1D - 1 Day
subsection.p: Example of a 1D calculation, first of all it calculates the Spot Day (spotLag=2) and then adds 1 day to it

subsection.name: 2D - 2 Day
subsection.p: Example of a 2D calculation, first of all it calculates the Spot Day (spotLag=2) and then adds 2 days to it and it must roll forward as the calculated date falls on a weekend.

subsection.name: 1W - 1 Week
subsection.p: Example of a 1W calculation, first of all it calculates the Spot Day (spotLag=2) and then adds 1 week to it and it must roll forward as the calculated date falls on a holiday.

subsection.name: 1M - 1 Month
subsection.p: Example of a 1M calculation, first of all it calculates the Spot Day (spotLag=2) and then adds 1 month to it. Notice that it falls on the last day of the month too.

subsection.name: 1Y - 1 Year
subsection.p: Example of a 1Y calculation, first of all it calculates the Spot Day (spotLag=2) and then adds 1 year to it. Notice that it falls on a weekend and hence is moved forward (if HandlerHolidayType is 'forward').
